data.name: Argument_BufferIndexExceedsCapacity
data.value: The specified buffer index is not within the buffer capacity.

data.name: Argument_BufferLengthExceedsCapacity
data.value: The specified useful data length exceeds the capacity of this buffer.

data.name: Argument_IndexOutOfArrayBounds
data.value: The specified index is out of bounds of the specified array.

data.name: Argument_InstancesImplementingIRASThatCanReadMustImplementIIS
data.value: The specified Windows Runtime stream supports the IRandomAccessStream interface and its CanRead property returns TRUE, however it does not implement the IInputStream interface. Windows Runtime streams with such inconsistent capabilities cannot be converted to managed Stream objects. IRandomAccessStream instances whose CanRead property returns TRUE must implement the IInputStream interface.

data.name: Argument_InstancesImplementingIRASThatCanWriteMustImplementIOS
data.value: The specified Windows Runtime stream supports the IRandomAccessStream interface and its CanWrite property returns TRUE, however it does not implement the IOutputStream interface. Windows Runtime streams with such inconsistent capabilities cannot be converted to managed Stream objects. IRandomAccessStream instances whose CanWrite property returns TRUE must implement the IOutputStream interface.

data.name: Argument_InsufficientArrayElementsAfterOffset
data.value: The specified array does not contain the specified number of elements starting at the specified offset.

data.name: Argument_InsufficientBufferCapacity
data.value: The specified buffer capacity is not sufficient to hold data of the specified length.

data.name: Argument_InsufficientSpaceInSourceBuffer
data.value: The specified source buffer does not contain the specified number of elements starting at the specified offset.

data.name: Argument_InsufficientSpaceInTargetBuffer
data.value: The specified destination buffer is not large enough to hold the specified number of bytes starting at the specified offset.

data.name: Argument_NotSufficientCapabilitiesToConvertToWinRtStream
data.value: Cannot convert the specified Stream object to a Windows Runtime stream because it does not have sufficient capabilities. In order to convert a System.IO.Stream instance to a Windows Runtime stream at least one of the properties CanRead, CanWrite, CanSeek must return TRUE; however, none of these properties returns TRUE for the specified Stream.

data.name: Argument_ObjectMustBeWinRtStreamToConvertToNetFxStream
data.value: The specified object cannot be converted to a System.IO.Stream instance because it is not a Windows Runtime stream. In order to convert an object to a Stream instance it must implement at least one of the following 3 Windows Runtime stream interfaces: IInputStream, IOutputStream, IRandomAccessStream.

data.name: Argument_RelativePathMayNotBeWhitespaceOnly
data.value: The specified relative path may not consist of white spaces only

data.name: Argument_StreamPositionBeyondEOS
data.value: The specified stream position is beyond the end of the stream.

data.name: Argument_UnexpectedAsyncResult
data.value: The specified AsyncResult does not correspond to any outstanding IO operation.

data.name: Argument_WinRtStreamCannotReadOrWrite
data.value: The specified Windows Runtime stream does not support reading nor writing. Windows Runtime streams with such capabilities cannot be converted to managed Stream objects. Use a Windows Runtime stream that can support reading, writing or both.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_CannotResizeStreamToNegative
data.value: Cannot set the length of a stream to a negative value.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_IO_CannotSeekToNegativePosition
data.value: Cannot seek to an absolute stream position that is negative.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_InvalidInputStreamOptionsEnumValue
data.value: The specified value is not a valid member of the InputStreamOptions enumeration.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_WinRtAdapterBufferSizeMayNotBeNegative
data.value: The buffer size for a Windows Runtime stream adapter may not be negative. Use a positive buffer size or 0 to disable buffering.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CannotCallThisMethodInCurrentState
data.value: The state of this object does not permit invoking this method.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CannotChangeBufferSizeOfWinRtStreamAdapter
data.value: Cannot convert the specified Windows Runtime stream to a managed System.IO.Stream object with the specified buffer size because this Windows Runtime stream has been previously converted to a managed Stream object with a different buffer size. Ensure that the 'bufferSize' argument matches the existing buffer or use the '{0}'-overload without the 'bufferSize' argument to convert the specified Windows Runtime stream to a Stream object with the same buffer size as previously.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CannotChangeBufferSizeOfWinRtStreamAdapterToZero
data.value: Cannot convert the specified Windows Runtime stream to a managed System.IO.Stream object without a buffer because this Windows Runtime stream has been previously converted to a managed Stream object with a buffer. Ensure that the 'bufferSize' argument matches the existing buffer or use the '{0}'-overload without the 'bufferSize' argument to convert the specified Windows Runtime stream to a Stream object with the same buffer size as previously.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CannotGetResultsFromIncompleteOperation
data.value: Cannot call GetResults on this asynchronous info because the underlying operation has not completed.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CannotSetCompletionHanlderMoreThanOnce
data.value: The 'Completed' handler delegate cannot be set more than once, but this handler has already been set.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CannotSetStreamSizeCannotWrite
data.value: Cannot set the size of this stream because it cannot be written to.

data.name: InvalidOperation_IllegalStateChange
data.value: The specified state transition is illegal for the current state of this object.

data.name: InvalidOperation_InvalidAsyncCompletion
data.value: The asynchronous operation could not be completed.

data.name: InvalidOperation_MultipleIOCompletionCallbackInvocation
data.value: A callback for the same asynchronous IO operation was invoked more than once.

data.name: InvalidOperation_TaskProviderReturnedUnstartedTask
data.value: The Task provider delegate specified for this IAsyncInfo instance returned a Task object that was not started. Task instances must be run immediately upon creation.

data.name: InvalidOperation_UnexpectedAsyncOperationID
data.value: This AsyncResult or Task corresponds to a different asynchronous operation ID than the one that invoked the completion callback.

data.name: InvalidOperation_UnstartedTaskSpecified
data.value: The specified underlying Task is not started. Task instances must be run immediately upon creation.

data.name: IO_CannotSeekBeyondInt64MaxValue
data.value: Cannot seek to an absolute stream position that is larger than 2^63 - 1 bytes. (2^63 - 1 = 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF = Int64.MaxValue).

data.name: IO_CannotSetSizeBeyondInt64MaxValue
data.value: This Windows Runtime stream is backed by a .NET Stream; its size cannot be set to a value that is larger than 2^63 - 1 bytes. (2^63 - 1 = 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF = Int64.MaxValue).

data.name: IO_General
data.value: An IO error occurred in the Windows runtime system.

data.name: IO_UnderlyingWinRTStreamTooLong_CannotUseLengthOrPosition
data.value: This Stream is backed by a Windows Runtime stream with a length that exceeds 2^63 - 1 bytes. Operations related to the stream's length or position cannot be performed on streams when the length exceeds 2^63 - 1 bytes. (2^63 - 1 = 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF = Int64.MaxValue = approx. 8000 PetaBytes.)

data.name: NotImplemented_NativeRoutineNotFound
data.value: A native library routine was not found: {0}.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotConvertNotReadableToInputStream
data.value: Cannot use the specified Stream as a Windows Runtime IInputStream because this Stream is not readable.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotConvertNotSeekableToRandomAccessStream
data.value: Cannot use the specified Stream as a Windows Runtime IRandomAccessStream because this Stream does not support seeking.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotConvertNotWritableToOutputStream
data.value: Cannot use the specified Stream as a Windows Runtime IOutputStream because this Stream is not writable.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotReadFromStream
data.value: This stream does not support read access.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotSeekInStream
data.value: This stream does not support seeking.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotUseLength_StreamNotSeekable
data.value: This stream does not support the Length property because it is not seekable.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotUsePosition_StreamNotSeekable
data.value: This stream does not support the Position property because it is not seekable.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotWriteToStream
data.value: This stream does not support write access.

data.name: NotSupported_CloningNotSupported
data.value: This IRandomAccessStream does not support the {0} method because it requires cloning and this stream does not support cloning.

data.name: NullReference_IOCompletionCallbackCannotProcessNullAsyncInfo
data.value: The Windows Runtime stream that underlies this System.IO.Stream object has invoked an IO completion callback and specified null for the IAsyncInfo instance that describes the completed IO operation. This behavior is not supported because results cannot be retrieved from a null operation. Either the underlying Windows Runtime stream has a faulty implementation, or you are using a Windows Runtime object in an unsupported runtime environment.

data.name: NullReference_TaskProviderReturnedNull
data.value: The task provider delegate used to create this asynchronous operation returned null, but a valid Task object was expected.

data.name: ObjectDisposed_AsyncInfoIsClosed
data.value: The requested invocation is not permitted because this IAsyncInfo instance has already been closed.

data.name: ObjectDisposed_CannotPerformOperation
data.value: The requested operation cannot be performed because this stream has already been disposed.

data.name: WinRtCOM_Error
data.value: An error has occurred.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_MustBePositive
data.value: '{0}' must be greater than zero.

data.name: ObjectDisposed_StreamClosed
data.value: Cannot access a closed Stream.

data.name: NotSupported_UnseekableStream
data.value: Stream does not support seeking.

data.name: NotSupported_UnreadableStream
data.value: Stream does not support reading.

data.name: NotSupported_UnwritableStream
data.value: Stream does not support writing.

data.name: ArgumentNull_Buffer
data.value: Buffer cannot be null.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_NegFileSize
data.value: Length must be non-negative.

data.name: NotSupported_CannotWriteToBufferedStreamIfReadBufferCannotBeFlushed
data.value: Cannot write to a BufferedStream while the read buffer is not empty if the underlying stream is not seekable. Ensure that the stream underlying this BufferedStream can seek or avoid interleaving read and write operations on this BufferedStream.

data.name: Argument_InvalidSafeBufferOffLen
data.value: Offset and length were greater than the size of the SafeBuffer.

data.name: InvalidOperation_CalledTwice
data.value: The method cannot be called twice on the same instance.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_LengthGreaterThanCapacity
data.value: The length cannot be greater than the capacity.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_UnmanagedMemStreamWrapAround
data.value: The UnmanagedMemoryStream capacity would wrap around the high end of the address space.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_Enum
data.value: Enum value was out of legal range.

data.name: NotSupported_UmsSafeBuffer
data.value: This operation is not supported for an UnmanagedMemoryStream created from a SafeBuffer.

data.name: IndexOutOfRange_UMSPosition
data.value: Unmanaged memory stream position was beyond the capacity of the stream.

data.name: IO_SeekBeforeBegin
data.value: An attempt was made to move the position before the beginning of the stream.

data.name: Argument_InvalidSeekOrigin
data.value: Invalid seek origin.

data.name: IO_FixedCapacity
data.value: Unable to expand length of this stream beyond its capacity.

data.name: IO_StreamTooLong
data.value: Stream was too long.

data.name: Arg_BufferTooSmall
data.value: Not enough space available in the buffer.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_NeedNonNegNum
data.value: Non-negative number required.

data.name: Argument_InvalidOffLen
data.value: Offset and length were out of bounds for the array or count is greater than the number of elements from index to the end of the source collection.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_StreamLength
data.value: Stream length must be non-negative and less than 2^31 - 1 - origin.

data.name: DirectUI_Empty
data.value: Empty.

data.name: InvalidOperation_SendNotSupportedOnWindowsRTSynchronizationContext
data.value: Send is not supported in the Windows Runtime SynchronizationContext

data.name: UnauthorizedAccess_InternalBuffer
data.value: MemoryStream's internal buffer cannot be accessed.
